content:
stanford in conjunction with the Sports for Social Change program is hosting a talented group of young soccer coaches committed to social impact PERIOD

The Sports for Social Change program enables coaches to build communities of young people through soccerand hopes to combathuman trafficking through the efforts PERIOD The coaches have worked in Cambodia and Vietnam and collaborate with Stanford students ontheir project PERIOD

Now these coaches have the opportunity to meet a broader portion of the Stanford community PERIOD Stanford students are hosting the coaches on campus this week in an effort to recruit more students forthe program PERIOD The Haas Center will send six students to work with the program in Southeast Asia this summer and ishosting an information session this evening PERIOD

This interaction between cultures is central to the program PERIOD

By playing soccer and working together to teach little kids and learn about Vietnamese Cambodian and American cultures we have developed our team spirit said Hoa Tu Trieu a coach from Vietnam PERIOD

Sports for Social Change has currently impacted  youths in Cambodia and Vietnam and  Stanford students have served as coaches in the past PERIOD This years cohort will begin working in June PERIOD



Contact Michael Gioia at mgioia2 at stanford.edu PERIOD

Michael Gioia was Managing Editor of Opinions from Vol PERIOD  he also previously led the News division PERIOD He is from Plano Texas and studied History and Modern Languages at Stanford PERIOD When Michael is not working for The Daily he can generally be found reading or drinking coffee PERIOD
